snippet: Town officials from Ramapo, which purchased the house seven years ago, say they plan to fix the house, but do not have the money to address its myriad problems.
abstract: Stone cottage built by artist Henry Varnum Poor in 1920, which was bought with intention of restoring it as cultural center by town of Ramapo, NY, is in state of severe disrepair; preservationists have grown impatient with town and fear house may be beyond repair; Poor's son Peter has indicated that he no longer intends to donate contents of house and artworks made by his father to project unless he has assurance that property will be stabilized.

byline.original: By COLIN MOYNIHAN and ROBIN POGREBIN

lead_paragraph: Town officials from Ramapo, which purchased the house seven years ago, say they plan to fix the house, but do not have the money to address its myriad problems.

headline.main: Efforts to Preserve Henry Varnum Poor’s House and Its History Have Stalled
headline.print_headline: House and Its History at Risk, as Preservation Efforts Stall
